intro: Oenothera prismatica var. viminea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant is part of the Onagraceae family and is known for its medicinal properties due to the presence of essential fatty acids. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
